review: Love the Chromecast. Wish I had one of the phones that can mirror there screen to it, but it's not been that big of a deal. Pair the Chromecast with some all's and you can get all your media on the TV. I use it in combination with a Plex server and it's beautiful. Have some media on my phone, use Allcast or Localcast. I used the WatchESPN app to stream the World Cup live, in HD (my TV cable provider was terrible quality). Use Google Play or Pandora for music. Cast some funny YouTube clips and show family photos from our most recent travels. More apps continue to support Chromecast and updates for Chromecast continue as well. Love this little thing.

review: I am actually pretty disappointed with this product. It sometimes has a really significant audio lag when playing Netflix, HBO Go, or Plex. Also, I recently bought a new router (Netgear R6300v2), and the Chromecast is incompatible with it. I've never heard of a device being incompatible with a specific router. I live with 2 roommates and we all have a lot of Wi-Fi devices and they all work fine. Phones, tablets, laptops, desktops, my TV, etc... EVERYTHING works with my new router...except the Chromecast. I guess I'm only out $35, which isn't so bad. The audio lag is bad enough, now it has compatibility issues? No thank you. I'm going to get a Roku or something else.
